isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Oil System Module Assembly - Installation - Prime Lubrication System

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, after engine or lubrication system service, prime engine with oil before starting engine. This will lubricate internal engine components during the critical initial startup phase.

note.para: After a complete engine rebuild, a dry engine should be filled with 35 quarts of engine oil (total). After running engine, recheck oil level and fill to the full mark.

step1.para: Remove M12 plug assembly and pressurize lubrication system with sufficient engine oil to fill the oil filter and charge the entire lubrication system. See Engine Operation and Maintenance Manual for proper grade and viscosity of engine oil.
Install M12 plug assembly and tighten to special torque .

Finish fill to engine oil specifications
remembering to subtract oil added during lubrication system pressurization and oil added directly to the oil filter.
Start engine and check for oil leaks. If oil is leaking, turn off engine and repair leaks.
Turn off engine. Check oil level and fill to the full mark.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, use the Pressurization method to prime lubrication system after an engine overhaul.

step1.para: Fill engine with the proper grade, viscosity, and quantity of engine oil. See Engine Operation and Maintenance Manual. Do not exceed total oil fill specifications .
Crank engine until the oil pressure gauge shows sufficient oil pressure.
After oil pressure is evident in the lubrication system, reconnect CMP sensor connector and start engine.
Start engine and check for oil leaks. If oil is leaking turn off engine and repair leaks.
Turn off engine and clear CMP fault code. See EGES-370 Diagnostic Manual.
Check oil level and fill to the full mark.
